detailed_results.reasoning: The gold formula forbids rejecting a request specifically when it is valid (!valid_request_rejected). The prediction forbids rejecting any request at all (!request_rejected), which is strictly stronger and changes the meaning by dropping the validity condition.

detailed_results.input: The drone can guarantee that sooner or later it will reach the destination waypoint.
detailed_results.reasoning: The temporal operator and coalition match, but the atomic proposition differs: gold requires eventually being at the (destination) waypoint (at_waypoint), while the prediction requires eventually being at_destination. These are not guaranteed to be equivalent.

detailed_results.input: It is not the case that robots 1, 2 and 3 have a strategy to enforce globally position 1.
detailed_results.reasoning: The input and gold formula negate the coalition ability: it is NOT the case that <<Robot1,Robot2,Robot3>> can enforce G pos1. The prediction omits the outer negation, asserting they do have such a strategy, which is the opposite meaning.

detailed_results.input: The world’s stable now. People are happy; they get what they want, and they never want what they can’t get. They’re well off; they’re safe; they’re never ill; they’re not afraid of death; they’re blissfully ignorant of passion and old age; they’re plagued with no mothers or fathers; they’ve got no wives, or children, or lovers to feel strongly about; they’re so conditioned that they practically can’t help behaving as they ought to behave.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold states only that the World can guarantee stability always (<<World>>G stable). Prediction strengthens the property by additionally requiring happiness and getting what they want, and even nests an extra global condition about not wanting what they can’t get. This changes the expressed meaning relative to the gold.

detailed_results.input: If we wish to fight, the enemy can be forced to an engagement even though he be sheltered behind a high rampart and a deep ditch. All we need do is attack some other place that he will be obliged to relieve.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold is a conditional: if the enemy is sheltered behind rampart and ditch, then we attack some other place (to force engagement). Prediction instead states that we can guarantee globally that both attack and enemy_relief hold, with different propositions and missing the implication and shelter conditions; it also adds a G temporal operator not present in gold.

detailed_results.input: The robot number 1 has a strategy to guarantee that if position 1 holds now then position 4 will eventually hold.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold states a one-time condition: if pos1 holds in the current state, then pos4 will eventually hold. The prediction adds a global G, requiring this implication to hold at all future states, which is strictly stronger and changes the meaning.

detailed_results.input: The collaborative robot can guarantee that sooner or later it will resume work after a pause.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold states the cobot can ensure that eventually work_resumed holds (<<Cobot>>F work_resumed) unconditionally. Prediction instead requires that whenever paused holds, then from the next step it is inevitable that eventually work_resumed (<<Cobot>>G(paused -> X F work_resumed)). This is a stronger, conditional property and does not match the simple eventuality in the gold.

detailed_results.input: The robot number 3 does not have a strategy to ensure that in the next state either position 1 or position 2 are valid.
